 Create a new image in the filesystem using Magick++, reflecting the current state of the press clip.

Detailed Description

This class manages a press clip within a newspaper's page, storing it as a set of pixels from an underlying image that representes the whole page. It is assumed that the origin of coordinates is located at the top leftmost pixel in the underlying image, as well in the clip itself.

The newspaper pages are images that may come in several formats, such JPEG, PDF, PNG, etc. The Magick++ library (an API for the ImageMagick suite) provides an abstraction layer to keep the code independent from the image format, so that other classes have an unified way to work with images. In future modifications any other library can be added to load images. In such case, the constructor and the writeToOutputImage method must be overloaded.

See also:
Magick++ API

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Clip::Clip ( const Magick::Image &  image,
const unsigned int &  x,
const unsigned int &  y,
const unsigned int &  height,
const unsigned int &  width 
) [explicit]

Parameters:
image Underlying image which the clip belongs to.
x X-axis coordinate of the row in the underlying image where the top leftmost pixel of the clip is.
y Y-axis coordinate of the column in the underlying image where the top leftmost pixel of the clip is.
height Height of the clip in pixels.
width Width of the clip in pixels.
Postcondition:
The image is stored internally using a grayscale colorspace.
Exceptions:
NessieException

void Clip::writeToOutputImage ( const std::string &  outputFile,
const double &  scalingFactor = 1.0 
) const

Parameters:
outputFile A string with the image name in the filesystem.
scalingFactor Top limit of the source image scale to use in the output image (i.e. 1 for [0..1], 255 for [0..255], etc.).
Postcondition:
A new image file is created in the filesystem. The image type is assigned according to the file extension provided in the filename (e.g. "foo.png" selects PNG as the image type). Otherwise the image type is Magick++'s implementation-dependent.
